text: Spice Money is a rural financial services company based in Noida, India. It was founded in 2000 by Dilip Modi and is a subsidiary of DiGiSPICE Technologies. The company offers services like money transfers, cash deposits, account opening, bill payments, and mini ATMs. It works with local agents called "Adhikaris" to provide banking services. As of 2024, it had 1.4 million Adhikaris. == History == Spice Money started as a digital wallet under the name Spice Digital Limited. It later expanded into ticketing, bill payments, banking services, and micro ATMs. In 2015, it received RBI approval to operate as a prepaid payment instrument. In 2017, it launched micro ATMs and bill payment services, followed by a mobile POS (mPOS) service in 2018, earning an award from NPCI. In 2018, it also received a license from the Reserve Bank of India to operate as a Bharat Bill Payment Operating Unit (BBPOU). == References == Category:2000 establishments
title: Spice Money
